metadata.title: CVE-2022-22751 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers Calixte Denizet, Kershaw Chang, Christian Holler, JasonKratzer, Gabriele Svelto, Tyson Smith, Simon Giesecke, and Steve Finkreported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 95 and Firefox ESR 91.4.Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume thatwith enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.5, Firefox < 96, andThunderbird < 91.5.

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
